channel.title: Golang Weekly
channel.description: A weekly newsletter about the Go programming language

item.title: „ÄêLet's get patching„ÄëËÆ©Êàë‰ª¨ÂºÄÂßãÊâìË°•‰∏ÅÂêß
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã514 ‚Äî July 9, 2024

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

Locally Patching Dependencies in Go ‚Äî When you want to temporarily modify the code of a dependency (say, with a log statement or small change), go mod makes it super simple. There are also some tools and other approaches to¬†consider.

Eli Bendersky

Using Go to Send 500 Million HTTP Requests to 2.5 Million Hosts ‚Äî Dawid leant on Go‚Äôs powerful concurrency features to speed up the mammoth task of sending 500 million HTTP requests quickly, but had to poke around a little to do it. As ever, use this knowledge for good, not¬†evil¬†:-)

Dawid Moczad≈Ço

Build Go Apps That Scale on AWS ‚Äî Learn how to build and deploy scalable applications to AWS using Go. This detailed video course will cover AWS Lambda, DynamoDB, API Gateway, JSON Web Tokens, and¬†more.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Using Profile-Guided Optimization (PGO) for Go Apps ‚Äî We‚Äôve featured many case studies of the improvements teams have seen when using PGO recently ‚Äì here‚Äôs Google‚Äôs high level take on getting started yourself before you dig into the¬†docs.

Cameron Balahan and James Ma

IN BRIEF:

  • Go 1.22.5 and Go 1.21.12 were released, including a security¬†fix.

  • A couple of months ago we featured the Go-powered Logdy log viewing tool ‚Äì it's just been updated to support being embedded directly into Go apps to make your app observability even¬†better.

  • Some tips for moving between Go and C#.

üìÑ Resetting Timers in Go ‚Äì ‚ÄúIf you use Timer.Reset() in Go 1.22 or earlier, you may be doing it¬†wrong.‚Äù Anton Zhiyanov

üìÑ Compile Go Directly to WebAssembly Components with TinyGo and WASI P2 Eric Gregory (wasmCloud)

üìÑ Error Handling in Go Web Apps Shouldn't Be So Awkward ‚Äì A useful error handling pattern for REST, gRPC, and other¬†services. Jonathan Hall

üìÑ Know When to Break Up with Go's http.DefaultClient Vishnu Bharathi

üìÑ Automating Image Metadata Extraction with AWS Lambda, Go, and Postgres H√ºseyin BABAL

üìÑ Contextualizing the Go Context API: Program Scopes Matt T. Proud

üìÑ How to Implement OAuth 2.0 into a Go App Permify

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Want to kill meetings? We‚Äôre looking for software engineering leaders to join the beta for a product aiming to do just that. Apply¬†here.

üõ† Code & Tools

Giu 0.8: A Dear ImGui-Based Cross Platform GUI Framework ‚Äî Another way to create GUI apps in Go. Dear ImGui is an interesting GUI library (for C++) that generates UIs aimed at power users in¬†particular.

Allen Dang

CxGo: A Tool for Transpiling C to Go ‚Äî There‚Äôs an online demo if you want to see a basic example of what goes in and comes¬†out.

Go Transpile

Stop Worrying About Your Auth. Let FusionAuth Handle It ‚Äî Flexible deployment. Advanced features like MFA, SSO, and more. Check out the Go¬†SDK.

FusionAuth sponsor

üí°¬†OpenHue Go: Interact with Philips Hue Smart Lighting ‚Äî Philips‚Äô range of Hue smart lights are pretty neat (I‚Äôve had a few!) and if, for some reason, you‚Äôd like to fiddle with your lights from Go code, now there‚Äôs a¬†way.

OpenHue Project

Joker 1.4: A Small Interpreted Dialect of Clojure Written in Go ‚Äî A small interpreter, linter and formatter for the popular Lisp dialect. GitHub¬†repo.

Roman Bataev

Ergo 2.14: A Modern IRC Server/ircd ‚Äî Formerly known as Oragono, this is a Go-powered IRCv3-compatible chat server that continues to get frequent upgrades as a very mature¬†project.

Lingamneni, Oaks, Huber, Latt, et al.

CoreDNS: A DNS and Service Discovery Server ‚Äî A DNS server built in Go that supports a variety of plugins, is a CNCF graduated project, and can integrate with Kubernetes and numerous cloud providers, should you need¬†it.

CoreDNS Authors

OmniParser: A Go-Powered ETL System ‚Äî Ingest CSV, XML, JSON, EDIFACT, X12, and more, in a streaming fashion, and transform it into JSON based upon a schema itself written in¬†JSON.

JF Technology

  • gocron 2.8 ‚Äì Run Go functions at pre-determined¬†intervals.

  • Go Micro 5.3 ‚Äì Popular Go microservices framework.

  • River 0.9 ‚Äì Fast and reliable background jobs in¬†Go.

  • go-arg 1.5 ‚Äì Struct-based argument parsing.

„Äë

#‚Äã514 ‚Äî July 9, 2024

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

Dawid Moczad≈Ço

item.title: „ÄêWriting generic collection types„ÄëÁºñÂÜôÊ≥õÂûãÈõÜÂêàÁ±ªÂûã
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã513 ‚Äî July 2, 2024

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

Writing Generic Collection Types: The Missing Documentation ‚Äî Go 1.18 introduced generics, but the author found practical examples and documentation on creating generic collections to be lacking. Luckily, he‚Äôs done the experimentation for us and shares what he learnt after many hours of spinning his wheels on the¬†problem.

Zach Musgrave

Realtime Diagnostic Logging (or 'How to Really Spy on Your Go Web Apps') ‚Äî An exploration of some options to temporarily enable verbose logging for troubleshooting purposes and making those logs accessible from anywhere and in¬†real-time.

Vladimir Dementyev

Go! Unlock Your Tech Potential with Ardan Labs Consulting ‚Äî Struggling with skill gaps, development speed or complex tech challenges? Ardan Labs specializes in Go, Rust, Docker and K8s to accelerate your software development, optimize architecture, and manage tech debt. Let us supercharge your¬†team!

Ardan Labs Consulting sponsor

IN BRIEF:

  • ü§ñ Russ Cox is working on a bot to help automate tasks in the Go issue¬†tracker. The bot is called Gaby and you can learn more about it¬†here.

  • ‚úñÔ∏é Tic-Tac-TUI? A Bubble Tea-powered, TUI-based 'noughts and crosses' game, all written in¬†Go.

  • üá¶üá∫ GopherConAU 2024 takes place in Sydney this November and its CFP is now open until September¬†15.

How to Use a Go Library on a Web Page with WebAssembly ‚Äî Compiling Go code to WebAssembly opens up some interesting opportunities in the¬†browser.

Thomas Derflinger

üìÑ f-tests as a Replacement for Table-Driven Tests in Go Aliaksandr Valialkin

üìÑ How to Do 'Hotword' Detection with Streaming Speech-to-Text and Go ‚Äì Leans on AssemblyAI‚Äôs¬†platform. Yasoob Khalid

üìÑ A Silly Mistake I Made with io.TeeReader Vishnu Bharathi

üìÑ gRPC: The Good Parts Kevin McDonald

üõ† Code & Tools

River: A Fast, Robust Job Queue for Go ‚Äî A Postgres-backed background job system that encourages using the same database for your app and your jobs. v0.8 just landed, but the biggest recent addition is River UI, a way to more directly monitor and visualize what River is up¬†to.

Brandur Leach et al.

SmoothMQ: A Drop-in Replacement for Amazon SQS ‚Äî Simple Queue Service (SQS) is a distributed message queuing service offered as part of AWS. SmoothMQ offers the same API but in a single Go¬†binary.

Jay Goel

Your Fastest Path to Production ‚Äî Build, deploy, and scale your apps with unparalleled ease ‚Äì from your first user to your¬†billionth.

Render sponsor

üç™¬†Cookie: Cookies, But With Structs ‚Äî Set, get, and remove cookies, both plaintext and¬†signed.

Chase Pierce

  • lo 1.44 ‚Äì Lodash-style Go library offering generic functions over slices, maps, channels,¬†etc.

  • Chi 5.1 ‚Äì Popular composable router for building Go HTTP¬†services.

  • Vitess 20 ‚Äì Go-powered horizontal scaling approach for MySQL.

  • üìä go-echarts 2.4 ‚Äì Charting and data visualization¬†library.

  • GoBGP 3.28 ‚Äì BGP implementation in¬†Go.

  • fx 35.0 ‚Äì Powerful terminal JSON¬†viewer.

üéÅ And one for fun

Doggo: A Go-Powered Command Line DNS Client ‚Äî A DNS tool written in Go designed to be used at the terminal (not as a library). Well presented and a good example of a modern, Go-powered CLI tool. GitHub¬†repo.

Karan Sharma

„Äë

#‚Äã513 ‚Äî July 2, 2024

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

Writing Generic Collection Types: The Missing Documentation ‚Äî Go 1.18 introduced generics, but the author found practical examples and documentation on creating generic collections to be lacking. Luckily, he‚Äôs done the experimentation for us and shares what he learnt after many hours of spinning his wheels on the¬†problem.

Ardan Labs specializes in Go, Rust, Docker and K8s to accelerate your software development, optimize architecture, and manage tech debt. Let us supercharge your¬†team!

Ardan Labs Consulting sponsor

  • ‚úñÔ∏é Tic-Tac-TUI? A Bubble Tea-powered, TUI-based 'noughts and crosses' game, all written in¬†Go.

  • üá¶üá∫ GopherConAU 2024 takes place in Sydney this November and its CFP is now open until September¬†15.

How to Use a Go Library on a Web Page with WebAssembly ‚Äî Compiling Go code to WebAssembly opens up some interesting opportunities in the¬†browser.

Thomas Derflinger

üìÑ How to Do 'Hotword' Detection with Streaming Speech-to-Text and Go ‚Äì Leans on AssemblyAI‚Äôs¬†platform. Yasoob Khalid

üìÑ A Silly Mistake I Made with io.TeeReader Vishnu Bharathi

üìÑ gRPC: The Good Parts Kevin McDonald

Brandur Leach et al.

Render sponsor

Chase Pierce

  • lo 1.44 ‚Äì Lodash-style Go library offering generic functions over slices, maps, channels,¬†etc.

  • Chi 5.1 ‚Äì Popular composable router for building Go HTTP¬†services.

  • Vitess 20 ‚Äì Go-powered horizontal scaling approach for MySQL.

  • üìä go-echarts 2.4 ‚Äì Charting and data visualization¬†library.

  • GoBGP 3.28 ‚Äì BGP implementation in¬†Go.

  • fx 35.0 ‚Äì Powerful terminal JSON¬†viewer.

üéÅ And one for fun

Doggo: A Go-Powered Command Line DNS Client ‚Äî A DNS tool written in Go designed to be used at the terminal (not as a library). Well presented and a good example of a modern, Go-powered CLI tool. GitHub¬†repo.

item.title: „ÄêIt's about time„ÄëÊòØÊó∂ÂÄô‰∫Ü
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã515 ‚Äî July 16, 2024

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

Quartz: A Deterministic Time Testing Library ‚Äî A new mocking library designed for testing code that relies on time, by introducing a little determinism and control to proceedings.. GitHub¬†repo.

Spike Curtis

Go Range Iterators Demystified ‚Äî In Go 1.22 (behind a flag) or 1.23 (currently in the release candidate stage), you can use the range keyword to iterate over custom collection types. Zach walks (iterates?) us through from the basics up to some more complex¬†examples.

Zach Musgrave

WorkOS: The Modern Identity Platform for B2B¬†SaaS ‚Äî Start selling to enterprise customers with just a few lines of code. WorkOS provides flexible, easy-to-use APIs to integrate SSO, SCIM, and RBAC in minutes. It's used by hundreds of high-growth startups including Perplexity, Vercel, Drata, &¬†Webflow.

WorkOS sponsor

Building a Binary Search Tree with SIMD and Go's Assembler ‚Äî When you want a little more performance than Go provides naturally, or access to underlying CPU features unavailable in Go, leaning on assembly language is one way to do it. Cl√©ment shows a practical example¬†here.

Cl√©ment Jean

‚ö†Ô∏è Note that the tutorial above assumes knowledge of Go's assembler and doesn‚Äôt walk through the build process. I‚Äôve put together the pieces of Cl√©ment‚Äôs code into a single GitHub Gist to make it easier to reproduce for yourself,¬†though.

IN BRIEF:

  • The oft (and fairly)-criticized TIOBE Index of programming langauge popularity has had an update with Go moving up to 7th place, after only entering the top 10 earlier this year. A big relative jump, even if you question the¬†methodology.

  • üéß Mat Ryer went on the Go Time podcast to talk about how he builds HTTP services in Go nowadays, after 13 years of doing just¬†that.

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Give Your Go App 'Superpowers' with an Embedded NATS¬†Server ‚Äî NATS is a lightweight real-time client/server messaging system, but a cool feature of NATS is you can embed it directly into a Go app and take advantage of its features without relying on a separate¬†server.

Synadio

Profiling in Go: A Practical Guide ‚Äî Pinpoint performance bottlenecks in your apps by profiling their activity and optimizing things based on the¬†results.

Noam Yadgar

Kafka Is Dead, Long Live Kafka ‚Äî Kafka is polarizing, yet ubiquitous. What if you could run Kafka as a single, stateless Go binary and reduce your¬†costs?

WarpStream sponsor

üìÑ Mastering SOLID Principles with Go Examples Alex Pliutau

üìÑ Docker Best Practices: Choosing Between RUN, CMD, and ENTRYPOINT Jay Schmidt (Docker)

üìÑ Demystifying Go Strings Andrei Boar

üõ† Code & Tools

Fyne 2.5: GUI App Framework for Desktop, Mobile and Web ‚Äî Fyne isn‚Äôt a new project, but it‚Äôs been years since we featured it, and it‚Äôs a pretty neat way to build GUI and mobile apps with Go. v2.5 is a big release with support for Wayland as well as internationalization. It requires Go 1.19+. GitHub¬†repo.

Fyne Team

üí° In Writing GUI apps doesn't have to be painful, Nikola Ubaviƒá explains how he considered numerous languages and GUI app development approaches before settling on Go and¬†Fyne¬†(above).

Minigrad: Andrej Karpathy's Micrograd in Go ‚Äî A neural network library using an autograd approach. It‚Äôs essentially Andrej Karpathy‚Äôs (previously of OpenAI) Micrograd implementation in Go, rather than¬†Python.

Jeet

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Meetings should be more like code reviews. We're building a product for that and looking for software leaders to join the beta. Apply here.

üõ°Ô∏è Protect your application infrastructure running on AWS with this time tested and essential security checklist. Download now!

üé•¬†Iris seeks Sr. Backend Engineer for edge-deployed Go/Rust dev. Work on an AI-powered robotic camera platform. Remote, equity, competitive pay.

Build Tools for Go ‚Äî If the out-of-the-box build tools aren‚Äôt getting it done, here‚Äôs list of open source build tools to consider, including Mage and Taskfile.

Inkmi

Chiko: An Elegant gRPC TUI Client ‚Äî Uses the popular tview terminal UI widget library to offer a way to interact with gRPC¬†services.

felangga

timediff: Produce Human Readable, Relative Time Differences ‚Äî For example: timediff.TimeDiff(time.Now().Add(-3 * time.Minute)) would produce ‚Äú3 minutes¬†ago‚Äù.

MergeStat

  • GoReleaser 2.1 ‚Äì Build and release Go binaries for several¬†platforms.

  • phonenumbers 1.4 ‚Äì Go port of Google's libphonenumber library.

  • gocron 2.10 ‚Äì Run Go functions at pre-determined¬†intervals.

  • go-github 63.0 ‚Äì GitHub v3 API client¬†library.

  • fq 0.12 ‚Äì Like jq for binary¬†formats.

„Äë

#‚Äã515 ‚Äî July 16, 2024

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

Quartz: A Deterministic Time Testing Library ‚Äî A new mocking library designed for testing code that relies on time, by introducing a little determinism and control to proceedings.. GitHub¬†repo.

Spike Curtis

Go Range Iterators Demystified ‚Äî In Go 1.22 (behind a flag) or 1.23 (currently in the release candidate stage), you can use the range keyword to iterate over custom collection types. Zach walks (iterates?) us through from the basics up to some more complex¬†examples.

Zach Musgrave

WorkOS provides flexible, easy-to-use APIs to integrate SSO, SCIM, and RBAC in minutes. It's used by hundreds of high-growth startups including Perplexity, Vercel, Drata, &¬†Webflow.

WorkOS sponsor

  • The oft (and fairly)-criticized TIOBE Index of programming langauge popularity has had an update with Go moving up to 7th place, after only entering the top 10 earlier this year. A big relative jump, even if you question the¬†methodology.

  • üéß Mat Ryer went on the Go Time podcast to talk about how he builds HTTP services in Go nowadays, after 13 years of doing just¬†that.

Noam Yadgar

It requires Go 1.19+. GitHub¬†repo.

Fyne Team

üí° In Writing GUI apps doesn't have to be painful, Nikola Ubaviƒá explains how he considered numerous languages and GUI app development approaches before settling on Go and¬†Fyne¬†(above).

Jeet

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Meetings should be more like code reviews. We're building a product for that and looking for software leaders to join the beta. Apply here.

item.title: „ÄêGo 1.23 gets another step closer„ÄëGo 1.23 ÂèàÂêëÂâçËøàËøõ‰∫Ü‰∏ÄÊ≠•
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã512 ‚Äî June 25, 2024

Unsub¬†¬†|¬†¬†Web¬†Version

‚úàÔ∏è I've produced this issue a day early due to being en-route to the AI Engineer World's Fair, so any last minute news may be missed. If you're there, come and say hi, but you can also watch from afar through the livestreams that will be on YouTube this Wednesday and Thursday. See you again next¬†week!
__
Peter Cooper, your editor

Go Weekly

Three Ways to Think About Channels ‚Äî Channels seem trivial on the surface, but actually using them requires an understanding of Go's entire concurrency ecosystem. With such an understanding, you can pick the right primitives for your use case and not end up trapped in a world of¬†deadlocks.

Max Hoffman (DoltHub)

Go 1.23 Release Candidate 1 Released ‚Äî A simple announcement for the first release candidate of the upcoming, and rather exciting, 1.23 release. Perhaps more usefully, the draft Go 1.23 release notes have been fleshed out a bit¬†more.

The Go Team

Master the Basics of Go ‚Äî Join Maximiliano Firtman for this detailed video course covering the fundamentals of all things Go. You'll gain a thorough understanding of structures, goroutines, channels, async API calls, and much much¬†more.

Frontend Masters sponsor
